content:
ne

It’s tempting to think the biggest problem with
Herschel Walker’s Senate candidacy is his record of
lying about his own record. Some might also make the
case that the Georgia Republican’s biggest hurdle is his
dreadful personal background, including domestic
violence — he allegedly threatened to murder his ex-
wife — and talk of having a shootout with police.

But just as important is the first-time candidate’s
unfamiliarity with the basics of government and public
affairs.

As regular readers know, it was a few months ago
when Walker tried to share some thoughts on energy
policy. It was an embarrassing disaster: As my MSNBC
colleague Ja’han Jones put it, Walker “delivered a
